Graphical abstract Synthesis and characterization of new 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthols using pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a novel nano-structured molten salt and catalyst in compared with Ag–TiO2 nano composite. Pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a green and novel nano-structured molten salt catalyzed the synthesis of new 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives via the one-pot three-component condensation reaction between 2 or 4-aminopyridine, aromatic aldehydes and β-naphthol at room temperature under solvent-free conditions in comparison with Ag–TiO2 nano composite. Some advantages of the offered method are excellent cost effectiveness, catalytic efficiency, recycle and reusability of the catalyst. Pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} was fully characterized by IR, 1H NMR, 13C NMR, mass, thermal gravimetry (TG), derivative thermal gravimetry (DTG), differential thermal (DTA), X-ray diffraction patterns (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) analysis. Keywords Pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} Nano-structured molten salt Ag–TiO2 nano composite 1-( α-Aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol Solvent-free 1 Introduction Recently, novel directions of modern investigation, broadly defined as nano scale science and technology, have occurred [1,2]. Nano technology is the technology treatment with both single nano objects and materials, and devices based on them, and with methods that happened in the nano meter range. Nano materials are those materials whose main physical characteristics are dictated through the nano objects they include. Nano materials are classified into compact materials and nano dispersions [3,4]. Nano composites are a class of composites with at minimum one phase having a dimension in the neighborhood of 1–100nm [5]. Molten salts (MSs) and room temperature ionic liquids (RTILs) are both liquids particularly composed of ions. Commonly, molten salts mention to inorganic MSs and RTILs to organic onium salts molten below 100°C [6]. Molten salts or ionic liquids are in common specifically as liquid electrolytes which composed of ions. More lately, the melting point pattern has been offered to recognize between molten salt (highly viscous, high-melting and very corrosive medium) and ionic liquids (liquid below 100°C and comparatively low viscosity) [7]. Molten salts have significant potential as electrolyte materials. The molten salts, lately called “ionic liquids” have possessed much interest in various scientific fields [8]. Industrial applications of MSs and ILs have been developed particularly as reaction solvent, in separation process, and so on. Moreover it is attempted to polymerize salts into solid films. Many experiments have been carried out to develop an excellent ion-conductive matrix, and polymerization of molten salts is a capable technique to make highly ion-conductive polymer films [9]. MSs and ILs media are well recognized as electrolytes in batteries or heat transfer media in several applications [10]. In terms of green chemistry, the development and application of multi-component coupling reactions in aqueous media is favorable, as they provide simple and rapid access to a large number of organic molecules via a tolerable method [11]. On the other hands, MCRs are an excellent research area for biomimetic reactions. The elimination of solvents in chemical procedures or the replacement of hazardous solvents with relatively clean, cheap, non-flammable, benign and naturally occurring solvents with high particular heat capacities are primary objectives [12]. One of the significant classes of organic compounds is the 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthols, the so-called Betti bases [13]. The study of the chemistry of the Betti bases started at the onset of the 20th century when Betti described the synthesis of 1-(α-aminobenzyl)-2-naphthol [14]. Preparation of substituted Betti base derivatives has become an significant part of synthetic chemistry due to their attractive catalytic [15] and biological [16] properties. The typical Betti reaction is a three-component reaction between an aldehyde, ammonia or urea and β-naphthol [14]. Although, variations have been made to make Betti base derivatives through by quilinols [17], naphthols [18], alkyl amines to exchange ammonia [19], uncatalyzed in water [20], sulfanilic acid-functionalized silica-coated magnetite nanoparticles [21], N-heteroaryl aminonaphthol [22] and the addition of naphthols to preformed iminium salts has to be attained [23]. As a section of our continuous work to the development of eco-friendly benign synthetic processes for MCRs to synthesize numerous biologically important heterocyclic compounds [24], we have prepared a novel, efficient, green and reusable nano-structured molten salt and catalyst, namely pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} (Scheme 1 ) and used it for the highly effective synthesis of 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives under solvent-free conditions from 2 or 4-aminopyridine, aromatic aldehydes and β-naphthol at room temperature under solvent-free conditions (Scheme 2 ). Furthermore, to compare the catalytic activity of {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} in nano scale, Ag–TiO2 nano composite were applied instead of it in the synthesis of 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives in similar conditions Scheme 3 . 2 Experimental 2.1 General procedure for the synthesis of nano-structured molten salt catalyst: pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide To a round-bottomed flask (50mL) containing a solution of pyrazine (3mmol; 0.240g) in CH3CN (5mL), was dropwise added trinitromethane (6.2mmol; 0.936g) and heated over a period of 120min at room temperature. Then, the solvent was removed through distillation under reduced pressure and the product was dried under vacuum at 80°C for 120min. The yellow solid product was filtered, washed with diethyl ether for three times, and then dried under vacuum conditions. {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} was characterized by IR, 1H NMR, 13C NMR, mass, thermal gravimetry (TG), derivative thermal gravimetry (DTG), differential thermal (DTA), X-ray diffraction patterns (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) analysis (Scheme 1). Pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2}: Yellow solid; M.p: 118–120°C; Yield: 97% (1.112g); IR (KBr): υ 3407, 3144, 1751, 1584, 1384, 1340, 1092, 825cm−1; 1H NMR (400MHz, DMSO-d6 ): δppm 7.71 (s, 4H, CH), 14.31 (brs, 2H, NH); 13C NMR (100MHz, DMSO-d6 ): δppm 119.8, 134.9; MS: m/z =382 [M]+, 383 [M+H]+. 2.2 General procedure for the synthesis of Ag–TiO2 nano composite catalyst Ag–TiO2 nano composite as a catalyst was synthesized according to previous literature [25]. Titanium tetrachloride was applied as the starting material to make pure TiO2 through sol–gel technique and the preparation process and characterization methods were reported in previous work. Silver nitrate was appied as a silver source. The Ag immobilization onto the TiO2 nano particles was offered based on the earlier study. 2.3 General procedure for the synthesis of 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives as a novel Betti bases To a mixture of aromatic aldehydes (1mmol), β-naphthol (1mmol; 0.144g) and 2 or 4-aminopyridine (1mmol; 0.094g) in a round bottom flask, 1mol% of {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} nano-structured molten salt or 2mol% of Ag–TiO2 nano composite was added as catalyst and stirred at room temperature under solvent-free conditions for appropriate time (Table 4 ). After completion of the reaction as monitored by thin layer chromathography (TLC) (n-hexane/ethyl acetate: 5/2), ethyl acetate (10mL) was added to reaction mixture and stirred under reflux condition for 10min. Then, the resulting mixture was washed with water (10mL) and decanted to separate catalyst from the other materials (the reaction mixture was soluble in hot ethyl acetate and nano molten salt catalyst was soluble in water). The aqueous layer was decanted, separated and removed the water to give the catalyst for another reaction. The solvent of organic layer was removed and the crude product was purified by recrystallization from ethanol (95%). Note: In another procedure, for the recycle of Ag–TiO2 nano composite, at the end of reaction, warm ethyl acetate was added to the reaction mixture and centrifuged to separate product and starting materials from the catalyst (Ag–TiO2 nano composite as catalyst is insoluble in ethyl acetate). 2.4 Spectral data analysis for compounds 1-((4-Nitrophenyl)(pyridin-2-ylamino) methyl) naphthalen-2-ol ( Table 4 , entry 1): White solid; The structure of pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a novel nano-structured molten salt catalyst was studied and identified by FT-IR, 1H NMR, 13C NMR, mass, TG, DTG, DTA, XRD, SEM and TEM analysis. The IR spectrum of the nano-structured molten salt showed an abroad peak at 3407cm−1 which can be related to NH stretching group on pyrazine-1,4-diium ring. Furthermore, two peaks detected at 1584cm−1 and 1340cm−1 related to vibrational modes of NO2 bonds (Fig. 1 ). Moreover, the 1H NMR and 13C NMR spectra of the pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} in DMSO-d6 are represented in Figs. 2 and 3 . As it is shown at 1H NMR spectra in {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2}, the peak related to acidic hydrogen (NH) of nano-structured molten salt catalyst appeared at 14.31ppm and a singlet peak which is observed at 7.71ppm corresponded to the aromatic hydrogen’s (Fig. 2). Additionally, 13C NMR spectra of {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} was another indication to confirm the structure of it. The offered peak at 119.8 was corresponded to the carbon of —C(NO2)3 group in trinitromethanide and a singlet peak at 134.9ppm related to the aromatic carbon's (Fig. 3). Thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA), derivative thermal gravimetric (DTG) and differential thermal analysis (DTA) of {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} were also studied. The related diagrams are presented in Figs. 4–6 . These mentioned analysis clearly showed that the nano-structured molten salt catalyst has good stability; so that there was no obvious mass loss before 188°C. The considerable weight loss of the catalyst was happened after 188°C, which it can be acceptable for the catalytic applications in organic synthesis. Pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a nano-structured molten salt catalyst was studied through X-ray diffraction (XRD) pattern (Fig. 7 ), scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) (Fig. 8 ). In this regard, to confirm the structure of {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2}, initially, its XRD pattern was investigated. As shown in Fig. 7, the XRD patterns of nano-structured molten salt catalyst reveal peaks at 2θ≈16.00°, 20.20°, 21.00°, 23.60°, 24.40°, 24.60°, 25.70°, 26.50°, 27.20° and 32.40°, correspondingly, which was confirmed by the described value of scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) (Fig. 8). Peak width (FWHM), size and inter planer distance related to XRD pattern of {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} were considered in the 16.00°–32.40° degree and the attained results have been summarized in Table 1 . The average crystallite size D was studied using the Debye–Scherrer formula: D=Kλ/(βcosθ), where K is the Scherrer constant, λ being the X-ray wavelength, β is the half-maximum peak width, and θ is the Bragg diffraction angle. The average size of the nano-structured molten salt catalyst, consequently, achieved from this equation was found to be about 23.35–53.48nm, which is fundamentally in a good accordance with the scanning electron microscopy and transmission electron microscopy (Fig. 8). 3.2 Characterization of silver-titanium dioxide Ag–TiO2 as a nano composite catalyst The Ag–TiO2 nano composite was synthesized and considered conforming to previous literature [25]. Fractal geometry can be applied to quantitatively describe promiscuous shapes and surfaces [27]. The basic quantitative part of fractal geometry, the fractal dimension D, is a non-integer number with a Euclidean and non-Euclidean component. Various approaches have been applied to measure the D of a fracture surface. The mensuration of the framework of the fracture surface is one of the most frequently applied techniques. Gwyddion applies four ways to compute D from AFM data: (a) cube computing, (b) triangulation, (c) variance and (d) power spectrum repartition. Atomic force microscopy (AFM) is a wonderful system that is able to detect and calculate surface manufacture with extraordinary resolution and precision. AFM has a gigantic benefit, in that almost any sample can be imaged to be very hard, such as the surface of a ceramic material, or a dispersal of metallic nano composite, or very soft, for example importantly plastic materials, or distinct molecules of proteins. An AFM image affords information about surface morphologies of Ag–TiO2 nano composite through using the two- and three- dimensions. AFM images were taken with 2.1μm * 2.1μm scan area from the images. Fig. 9 display the two- and three- dimension AFM images of Ag–TiO2 nano composite. No main concision area in size is detected in the illustrations. From three-dimensional 2.1μm2 * 2.1μm2 framework, it comes out that the gained nano composite displays an interrupted structure with a preferable outside planarity. In the surface conformation of the coating, Ag–TiO2 with a particles size less than 25nm were detected obviously. 3.3 Application of pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} nano molten salt and silver-titanium dioxide Ag–TiO2 nano composite as a catalyst Firstly, to optimize the reaction conditions, the condensation reaction of naphthalene-1-carbaldehyde, β-naphthol and 2-aminopyridine was selected as a model and several amounts of nano catalyst at range of 25–100°C were tested under solvent-free conditions (Table 2 ). As presented in Table 1, indicates that the best results were achieved when the reaction was attained using 1mol% of nano-structured molten salt and 2mol% of Ag–TiO2 nano composite at room temperature (Table 2, entries 5 and 9). No improvement was detected in the yield of reaction through increasing the amount of the nano catalysts and the temperature. Table 2 obviously shows that in the absence of nano catalysts, reaction did not proceed and the product was not prepared (Table 2, entries 1 and 2). To compare the effect of the solution in comparison with solvent-free conditions, a mixture of naphthalene-1-carbaldehyde, β-naphthol and 2-aminopyridine as typical reaction, using 1 mol% of nano-structured molten salt and 2 mol% of Ag–TiO2 nano composite as a catalyst in various solvents such as H2O, C2H5OH, CH3CN, CH3CO2Et, CH2Cl2 and toluene was investigated at room temperature. The results are shown in Table 3 . As it can be displayed in Table 3, solvent-free condition was the best condition in this reaction. After optimization of the reaction conditions, to investigate the efficiency and the scope of the introduced method, numerous of 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives as a novel Betti bases were synthesized via the three-component condensation reaction between 2 or 4-aminopyridine, aromatic aldehydes and β-naphthol using a catalytic amount of pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a nano-structured molten salt catalyst and Ag–TiO2 as a nano composite catalyst at room temperature under solvent-free reaction conditions. The results have been depicted in Table 4. The effect of substituents on the aromatic ring was showed estimated strong effects in terms of yields under these reaction conditions. All aromatic aldehydes containing electron-releasing substituents, electron-withdrawing substituents on their aromatic ring gave the desired products in high to excellent yields in short reaction times. The reaction times of aromatic aldehydes having electron withdrawing groups were rather faster than electron donating groups. Furthermore, in this reaction condition 4-aminopyridine was reacted faster than 2-aminopyridine. As it is shown in Table 4, indicates that the achieved results (lower reaction time and higher isolated yields) revealed that the nano-structured molten salt as a catalyst (method A) was more successful than nano composite as a catalyst (method B) in this reaction conditions. According to previous studies [28], we have proposed a mechanism for the synthesis of 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives as a novel Betti bases using {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a nano-structured molten salt catalyst and Ag–TiO2 as a nano composite catalyst. Initially, nano-structured molten salt catalyst or Ag––TiO2 as a nano composite activates the carbonyl group of the aromatic aldehyde to give intermediate (1). Also, β-naphthol (2) in the presence of catalysts is converted to intermediate I. The condensation of intermediate (1) and (3 or 4) was occurred to form the iminium ion intermediate II. After the preparation of iminium ion intermediate II by the reaction of aldehyde 1 and 2-aminopyridine 3 or 4-aminopyridine 4, β-naphthol 2 attacks to iminium compound II was happened to form the intermediate III. Finally, a hydride shift of intermediate III leads the desired 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthols (5 or 6). Additionally, recycle and reusability of the catalyst was studied upon the condensation between naphthalene-1-carbaldehyde, β-naphthol and 2-aminopyridine. After the completion of the reaction, ethyl acetate was added to the reaction mixture and stirred and heated to separate product and remained starting materials from the catalyst. This solution was washed with water to separate catalyst from other materials (the product and starting materials are soluble in hot ethyl acetate and nano-structured molten salt catalyst is soluble in water). The aqueous layer was decanted and separated and the catalyst was reused for further reaction after removing of water. The activity of the catalyst was restored within the limits of the experimental errors for five continuous runs (Fig. 10 ). For recycling of Ag–TiO2 nano composite, at the end of reaction, warm ethyl acetate was added to the reaction mixture, stirred and heated to separate product and remained starting materials from the catalyst. Then, the obtained mixture was centrifuged to separate catalyst (Ag–TiO2 nano composite catalyst is insoluble in ethyl acetate and the reaction mixture is soluble in ethyl acetate). The structure of reused {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} was too confirmed through IR, 1H NMR and 13C NMR spectra after its utilization in the reaction. These offered spectra are in a very good agreement with the spectra of fresh catalyst (Figs. S3–S5). Furthermore, the size and morphology of reused catalysts were considered via SEM and TEM analysis. These studies were revealed that the catalysts were recovered in nano size (Fig. S6). 4 Conclusions In summary, a novel, green and effective nano-structured molten salt and catalyst namely pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} was designed and completely characterized through IR, 1H NMR, 13C NMR, mass, thermal gravimetry (TG), derivative thermal gravimetry (DTG), differential thermal (DTA), X-ray diffraction patterns (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) analysis. Catalytic application of {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} was considered in the synthesis of 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives as a novel Betti bases via the three-component condensation reaction among 2 or 4-aminopyridine, aromatic aldehydes and β-naphthol under solvent-free conditions at room temperature in comparision with Ag–TiO2 nano composite. The attained results showed that the {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} nano-structured molten salt was more successful than Ag–TiO2 nano composite as catalyst. Several significant advantages of this study are relatively low cost, cleaner reaction profile, simplicity of product isolation, short reaction time, high yield, reusability of the nano catalyst and compliance with the green chemistry protocols. coredata.dc:description: Pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a green and novel nano-structured molten salt catalyzed the synthesis of new 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthol derivatives via the one-pot three-component condensation reaction between 2 or 4-aminopyridine, aromatic aldehydes and β-naphthol at room temperature under solvent-free conditions in comparison with Ag–TiO2 nano composite. Some advantages of the offered method are excellent cost effectiveness, catalytic efficiency, recycle and reusability of the catalyst. Pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} was fully characterized by IR, 1H NMR, 13C NMR, mass, thermal gravimetry (TG), derivative thermal gravimetry (DTG), differential thermal (DTA), X-ray diffraction patterns (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) analysis.
coredata.dc:title: Synthesis and characterization of new 1-(α-aminoalkyl)-2-naphthols using pyrazine-1,4-diium trinitromethanide {[1,4-DHPyrazine][C(NO2)3]2} as a novel nano-structured molten salt and catalyst in compared with Ag–TiO2 nano composite
